comments:
i200409300800

Got the NPE below from the build.properties editor (using the Build tab) trying
to add a source folder to a library I had just added. The test case seems to be:
1) create a new library, *omiting* the .jar extension. It seems to be recognized
as a folder.
2) select and rename the entry to have .jar in its name
3) try to add a folder to the library or delete it. It will fail with NPEs like
below.

Restarted Eclipse and I could do the changes again. Guess just closing and
reopening the ditor would do it as well.

Trying to add folder:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Oct 01, 2004 11:10:03.134
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.build.RuntimeInfoSection.handleNew
Folder(RuntimeInfoSection.java:980)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.build.RuntimeInfoSection.access$1(
RuntimeInfoSection.java:912)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.build.RuntimeInfoSection$PartAdapt
er.buttonSelected(RuntimeInfoSection.java:110)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.parts.SharedPartWithButtons$SelectionHand
ler.buttonSelected(SharedPartWithButtons.java:34)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.parts.SharedPartWithButtons$SelectionHand
ler.widgetSelected(SharedPartWithButtons.java:27)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:
89)
...

This is when trying to delete it:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Oct 01, 2004 11:13:11.416
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.model.build.Build.remove(Build.java:54)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.build.RuntimeInfoSection.handleDel
ete(RuntimeInfoSection.java:881)
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.build.RuntimeInfoSection$7.run(Run
timeInfoSection.java:482)
...

The problem occurred because all build entries are stored in a hashmap with key
= build entry name.  Renaming was updating the build entry name but not
affiliating the new value with a new key in the hash map.  Thus, the entry was
always associated with the previous key (the build entry for the old runtime
library name in this case).

Thanks for the catch!

Fixed and released to head :)
